alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 7:18PM EDT until July 13 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Rutland County in southern Vermont... Western Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 1015 PM EDT. * At 718 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area over the next hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rutland, West Rutland, Proctor, Ira, Rutland City, Pittsford, Castleton, Clarendon, Hubbardton, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Middletown Springs, Poultney, Brandon, West Castleton, Mendon, Tinmouth, Chittenden, Lake St. Catherine, Fair Haven and Poultney Village. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
